DataElement.preferredName: Cardiac Performance Status Assessment Function Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the cardiac function assessment scale as described by the New York Heart Association.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the cardiac performance status assessment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart.:A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the heart.
A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Property.preferredDefinition: Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 03/06/20313 - tc - Remove concept CL092952 and replaced with NCIt concept C20641.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patients with cardiac disease but without resulting limitation of physical activity. Ordinary physical activity does not cause undue fatigue, palpitation, dyspnea or anginal pain.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patients with cardiac disease but without resulting limitation of physical activity. Ordinary physical activity does not cause undue fatigue, palpitation, dyspnea or anginal pain.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Patients with cardiac disease but without resulting limitation of physical activity. Ordinary physical activity does not cause undue fatigue, palpitation, dyspnea or anginal pain.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patients with cardiac disease resulting in slight limitation of physical activity. They are comfortable at rest. Ordinary physical activity results in fatigue, palpitation, dyspnea or anginal pain.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patients with cardiac disease resulting in slight limitation of physical activity. They are comfortable at rest. Ordinary physical activity results in fatigue, palpitation, dyspnea or anginal pain.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Patients with cardiac disease resulting in slight limitation of physical activity. They are comfortable at rest. Ordinary physical activity results in fatigue, palpitation, dyspnea or anginal pain.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patients with cardiac disease resulting in marked limitation of physical activity. They are comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary activity causes fatigue, palpitation, dyspnea or anginal pain.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patients with cardiac disease resulting in marked limitation of physical activity. They are comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary activity causes fatigue, palpitation, dyspnea or anginal pain.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Patients with cardiac disease resulting in marked limitation of physical activity. They are comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary activity causes fatigue, palpitation, dyspnea or anginal pain.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patients with cardiac disease resulting in inability to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Symptoms of heart failure or the anginal syndrome may be present even at rest.  If any physical activity is undertaken, discomfort increases.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patients with cardiac disease resulting in inability to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Symptoms of heart failure or the anginal syndrome may be present even at rest.  If any physical activity is undertaken, discomfort increases.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Patients with cardiac disease resulting in inability to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Symptoms of heart failure or the anginal syndrome may be present even at rest.  If any physical activity is undertaken, discomfort increases.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
